class.name: ImageIndexed
class.brief_description: Adds pseudo support for indexed images.
class.description: The class adds support for indexed images with a color palette and provides common operations to create, generate and operate on color palette and index data. This does not actually add a [code]FORMAT_INDEXED[/code] image format as modern GPUs don't actually support it, yet index data is stored internally alongside regular pixels if an image has a palette. This allows to interchange (swap, extend) index data to pixel data via [method apply_palette], allowing for things like simple palette swapping without using shaders, finding average/dominant colors in an image as the class provides a way to generate color palette with specified number of colors which involves color quantization.

method.name: apply_palette
method.description: Extends color palette associated with this image from index data and overwrites the original image. Note that the image will still be represented as true color.

method.name: clear_palette
method.description: Clears palette and associated index data from this image.

method.name: create_indexed
method.description: Internally allocates indexed image data with the same dimensions as in this image. The number of palette entries can be specified to allocate palette data to be used by image indices.

method.name: create_indexed_from_data
method.description: A low-level interface to allocate indexed image and color palette from raw data. Make sure that the data is valid and all indices point to valid color palette entries. The palette bitness is determined by image pixel size (in bytes).

method.name: generate_palette
method.description: Generates an optimal color palette for this image and maps it to indices. The maximum palette color size that can be generated is 256. Dithering can be applied to improve the overall look of the image with low number of colors, see [enum DitherMode]. If [code]with_alpha[/code] is [code]true[/code], the alpha channel will be included for quantization algorithm, set this to false if the image is already premultiplied by alpha or if you don't want the alpha values to affect palette generation. If [code]high_quality[/code] is [code]true[/code], the quantization algorithm will go through additional iteration, potentially improving color mapping quality in expense of performance. The image must be converted to [member Image.FORMAT_RGBA8] before generating palette. Note that this method overwrites previously created or generated palette and index data.

method.name: get_palette_color
method.description: Returns color palette entry at [code]index[/code] position.

method.name: get_palette_size
method.description: Returns the total number of color palette entries.

method.name: get_pixel_indexed
method.description: Returns an index which is mapped to color palette. See notes for [method Image.get_pixel].

method.name: has_palette
method.description: Return [code]true[/code] is this image has color palette.

method.name: load_indexed_png
method.description: Loads indexed PNG image from disk at specified path. If PNG image is not indexed, it will load the image normally without color palette, see [method Image.load]. If loaded image is indexed, the color palette and index data will be accessible from within this image. If this image is duplicated, the color palette and index data will not be copied, use [method get_index_data], [method get_palette_data] and [method create_indexed_from_data] to manually duplicate palette and index data.

method.name: lock_indexed
method.description: Locks the index data for writing access.

method.name: save_indexed_png
method.description: Saves indexed PNG image to disk at specified path. If image has palette and index data associated with it, the image will be saved as indexed, else saved as true color, see [method Image.save_png]. The image with transparency is saved in a separate PNG alpha chunk, preserving transparency in indexed image with regular RGB color palette.

method.name: set_palette_color
method.description: Sets color palette entry at [code]index[/code] position with [code]color[/code].

method.name: set_pixel_indexed
method.description: Sets an index which should be mapped to color palette. See notes for [method Image.set_pixel].

method.name: unlock_indexed
method.description: Unlocks the index data and prevents changes.

members.member: Represents the color palette of this image. The palette can be replaced if the image already has a palette with the same size. In order to change the number of palette entries, use [method create_indexed], [method generate_palette], or [method clear_palette]. Note that changing the palette size invalidates existing index data and has to be cleared, which is done automatically.

constants.constant: The maximum number of palette entries supported.
Do not apply image dithering during palette generation.
Applies ordered dithering during palette generation. The algorithm is characterized by noticeable crosshatch patterns to improve the image look with limited number of colors.
Applies random dithering during palette generation. The algorithm is characterized by noticeable random noise patterns to improve the image look with limited number of colors.
